page.title: 03Petworth Park
page.content: Petworth Park is in the north-westerly part of Petworth. The park covers 2,000 acres of land,800 owned by the Natural Trust 1,200 owned privately by Lord Egremont. The problems of Petworth Park are the deer eating the young trees,moles digging hills and there are over 1000 trees to be felled because they are rotting with old age. There is a ditch called 'The Ha Ha' separating the park from the House and the Gardens, which prevents the deer damaging the plants and getting killed on the road. The park was designed by Capability Brown in 1750. Mr.Webb (the education officer) took us round.
